sentences.english: With convincing power he portrayed the usurpation and corruptions of the papal see.
sentences.chinese: 他有力地抨擊羅馬教廷僭越權限和腐化敗壞的行爲。

sentences.english: With hierarchy being there, man ought to know his own limit and not trespass.
sentences.chinese: 既有了名份，人就該知道自己的限度，不可僭越。

sentences.english: More than this, the pope has been given the very titles of Deity.
sentences.chinese: 此外，更有甚者，就是教皇已僭稱了上帝的尊號。

sentences.english: He attempted to usurp the principal's authority.
sentences.chinese: 他企圖僭越校長的權力。

sentences.english: He arrogated the privilege to himself alone.
And, behold, certain of the scribes said within themselves, This man blasphemeth.
sentences.chinese: 有幾個文士心裏說，這個人說僭妄的話了。

sentences.english: Congress's arrogated powers over domains hitherto belonging to the states.
sentences.chinese: 國會僭越了迄今爲止屬於各州領域中的權力。

sentences.english: behold, now ye have heard his blasphemy.
sentences.chinese: 這僭妄的話，現在你們都聽見了。

sentences.english: I consider this woman as the usurper of my property.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲這個女人是僭取我的財產的人。

sentences.english: Very often the picture takes precedence over the point.
Each side now accuses the other of usurping power.
sentences.chinese: 雙方互相指責僭取權力。

sentences.english: I considered this woman as the usurper of my property.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲這個女人是僭取我的財產的人。

sentences.english: Look, now you have heard the blasphemy
sentences.chinese: 這僭妄的話，現在你們都聽見了。

sentences.english: Ye have heard the blasphemy: what think ye?
sentences.chinese: 你們已經聽見他這僭妄的話了。

definition: surname Cheng/Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BCE) vassal state
a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
steps leading to the eastern door
